intro: Archiserratula, commonly known as the desert flax, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellow to brown flowers that bloom in the spring. Archiserratula is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, with deep root systems that help it access water from underground sources. It plays an important role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for desert wildlife.
